meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Mark Pudlow Sara Lichterman Carl Bradshaw Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6100.

td.p: Mark Pudlow, a teachers' union spokesman from Havana, Florida
Sara Lichterman, a web editor from Arlington, Virginia
Carl Bradshaw, a financial manager from St. Louis, Missouri (whose 1-day cash winnings total $11,599)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '1902: This organization is founded in Chicago to promote safe roads; it still helps drivers today')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: 1902: This organization is founded in Chicago to promote safe roads; it still helps drivers today

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_2_1', 'clue_J_2_1_stuck', '(Oprah Winfrey gives the clue.) For a 2005 show on age-defying things for women, I had this part of my body "stabbed" with a special gun; I was told the 2 clicks would hurt "a little", yeah, right!')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Oprah Winfrey gives the clue.) For a 2005 show on age-defying things for women, I had this part of my body "stabbed" with a special gun; I was told the 2 clicks would hurt "a little", yeah, right!

Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: (Alex: Christopher Walken--in fact, Christopher Walken movies.)

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: Discovered around the turn of the century and valued as an anticancer agent.)
CarlWhat is Platinum
$2,100
SaraWhat is [gun powder crossed out] dynamite
$8,000
MarkWhat is plutonium?
$10,001
radium')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'In 1919, barely 20 years after its discovery, it was the world\'s most expensive substance at $3 million an ounce')

tr.td: In 1919, barely 20 years after its discovery, it was the world's most expensive substance at $3 million an ounce
